note.p: Death: His residence in Bayswater, London (27 January 1895)
Education: Charterhouse, Surrey; Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1842), MA(1845)
Career: Called to the Bar (1846); first Chief Justice of Queensland, Australia (1863); returned to England (1879)
Freemason, initated 26 February 1855, passed 26 November 1855 and raised 28 January 1856
Memberships: FRAS; FCPS; Philosophical Society of Queensland (President); FMS (President 1886-1888)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Charterhouse Miscellany
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1895-1896 vol 59 pp xxx-xxxix, plate, signed by R H
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
Library and Museum of Freemasonry, 'Freemasons and the Royal Society; Alphabetical List of Fellows of the Royal Society who were Freemasons' London, 2010, page 22
